ResourceHeader.ResourceName: STEREO/EUVI Event Catalog (>C1 GOES class or >12 keV RHESSI)
ResourceHeader.Description: This is a catalogue of flare/CME events observed with EUVI when the spacecraft separation angle is small to moderate when classical stereoscopy is feasible. The list contains also the peak fluxes in soft X rays and hard X rays. EUVI Classification: A=Ahead only without Behind data B=Behind only without Ahead data I=Impulsive time profile (peak in coincidence with SXR) P=Postflare loop or arcade (delayed emission after SXR peak) D=Dimming (EUV flux decreases after SXR peak) E=Eruptive filament O=Occulted for A (if flare position is east) or B (if west) T=Test images (or poor image quality) W=Waves and oscillations CME reported: L=LASCO/SOHO, S=SECCHI/Cor-1,Cor-2

InformationURL.Name: STEREO - SECCHI - EUVI (LMSAL)
InformationURL.Description: Links to documentation, images, movies, software and contact information.

AccessURL.Name: Early EUVI Event Catalog [195 events] at LMSAL

Parameter.Name: SC
Parameter.Description: A=Ahead only without Behind data B=Behind only without Ahead data

Parameter.Name: GOES
Parameter.Description: Importance of flare at X-ray wavelengths -- the peak flux measured at Earth in the 0.1 to 0.8 nm range in units of W m-2.

Parameter.Name: RHESSI
Parameter.Description: Peak RHESSI energy range in which event is observed.

Parameter.Name: CTS
Parameter.Description: Counts in peak RHESSI energy range.

Parameter.Name: COMMENTS
Parameter.Description: Comments using the following EUVI Classification: A=Ahead only without Behind data B=Behind only without Ahead data I=Impulsive time profile (peak in coincidence with SXR) P=Postflare loop or arcade (delayed emission after SXR peak) D=Dimming (EUV flux decreases after SXR peak) E=Eruptive filament O=Occulted for A (if flare position is east) or B (if west) T=Test images (or poor image quality) W=Waves and oscillations

Parameter.Name: CME
Parameter.Description: CME reported by one or both of the following: L=LASCO/SOHO S=SECCHI/Cor-1,Cor-2
